text:
A drunken brawl between Jeganathan (48) of Arundadiyar Colony, Mallur, and Gowri Sankar (30), both labourers, in an inebriated condition led to the death of Jeganathan.

The altercation broke out when Jeganathan refused to give Rs. 1,000 to Gowri Sankar. Gowri Sankar beat Jeganathan using a log. He died immediately. Gowri Sankar has been admitted to a hospital.

Six held

The police on Friday arrested six persons, and recovered gold jewellery weighing about 1 kg, a four-wheeler, and two motorcycles from them. The arrested were: J. Pandian (26), C. Anand (24), T. Vinodkumar (24), G. Annamalai (31), M. Yogeswaran (24), and K. ‘Chapatti’ Raman (30). Goondas Act was invoked against Pandian and Anand earlier.

Regulatory orders

City Police Commissioner Sumit Sharan has promulgated regulatory orders under Section 41 of the Tamil Nadu City Police Act, 1997 (Extended to the Cities of Salem, Tiruchi and Tirunelveli) for 15 days from midnight of February 12.

House burgled

Unidentified persons have entered the house of a catering service man in Sakthi Nagar in Kumaramangalam, near Tiruchengode, and decamped with gold jewellery weighing about 320 gm and Rs. 2.50 lakh. The incident took place when Moorthy (50) was away to attend a marriage function. When he returned on Friday, he found the front door of his house broken open.
title: Man murdered
